answers.answer: These are very serious problems especially if due to diabetes or "wet" macular degeneration. If you are concerned about "doing everything", get a second opinion from a retina ophthalmologist. Also be sure that your general ophthalmologist keeps your glasses up to date.JCH III MD Eye Physician & Surgeon

question: I had a retinal hemmorage 2 years ago and have had laser treatments and steroid injections.  It still has not improved my vision.  Is this all that can be done as most of my work is done on a computer and it is getting very difficult .smokeyI do not smoke!!!
title: ret hem
